topics: Introduction to Business Analytics & Basic Excel Skills

grading.policies: Graduate students need a grade of C or above to pass the course.

assignments.name: Homework
assignments.description: Exercises for methods/topics discussed each week. To be submitted online through Canvas. Name it Firstname_Lastname_Homework_X. Due before the next class begins. Late penalty: 20% per day. No homework will be accepted 3 days after the due date.

assignments.name: Final Project Report and Presentation
assignments.description: Students work in groups of 4 to identify a real-world business problem, collect and analyze data, and propose a solution. Includes an oral in-class presentation for 10-15 minutes (10%) and an 8-10 page written report in word format (25%).

policies.attendance: Attendance and participation in in-class exercises and discussions. Attendance without participation in class will only receive a passing grade (3%).
policies.late_work: Late penalty: 20% per day. No homework will be accepted 3 days after the due date.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: In-person class on Tuesdays from 6:30-9:00PM EST.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Please bring your laptop to class and install Excel, Tableau and RapidMiner on your laptop.
additional_info.support_resources: Microsoft Office for Stevens Students: https://sit.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1865/Portal/KB/ArticleDet?ID=28586; Tableau student license: https://www.tableau.com/academic/students; RapidMiner student license: https://rapidminer.com/educational-program/

course_info.title: Business Analytics: Data, Models, and Decisions

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces fundamental concepts, techniques, and tools of data analysis for business management and decision-making.
learning_outcomes: Understand concepts and roles of data analysis in business applications
Acquire techniques for describing, analyzing and interpreting data for business decision making
Learn how to apply software for data analysis, including Excel, Tableau and RapidMiner
